reviews.review_msg: Dr Sen is obvious an expert in this field and is very passionate and intelligent. You need to come to class as his notes are pretty bad. Test are fairly difficult as they ask you about experimental results and designs that were presented in class by students. If you take good notes and skim through the papers you'll do ok. Challenging class.

his notes are trash, you have to go to class, he is super hyper all the time and talks a lot, clearly he is passionate, first midterm avg was 57 and i got 42 and still ended up with a B- so i guess there is hope, second midterm was easier but still difficult overall, 2 midterms 45% each and 10% presentation which does not even seem to be graded

I took MBB420 as an intersession class (2 months) with Dr. Sen. It was awesome! He's such a wise man and often coloured the class with interesting anecdotes about the people who discovered whatever we were studying. He was so chill. Really easy exams, too. Majority of the mark was class presentation and participation (60% together).

One thing I cannot stress is: Make sure to go to class. All of his notes are written as he teaches along. He posts up the notes per week. I suggest you have a friend who keeps you updated. Two exams worth 45% each. First one is tough, make sure you know what you're up against. Use his office hours, helps clarify any questions.

Attend the classes. Try to stay awake in class and take your own notes. Study his notes (and yours) before the exam, and you'll be fine. I actually learned quite a bit in this class! (Only read the class summaries if you don't understand the notes)

Exams are ALL drawings from his notes with small descriptions, study off his notes and make your own notes to do well. He is a very picky marker, taking off a lot of part marks for bits of detail missing. Read the paper abstracts rather than the class presentation summaries for studying. He teaches interesting topics but the papers are very old.

Lectures were ok but material was hard and tests were hard unless you completely understood what was taught. Marking extremely difficult and awkward distribution. I didnt find info useful nor clear. Enjoyed lectures, interesting prof, but other than that didnt like the course.
great prof :D he has a high interest in DNA & RNA..especially DNA!! so i guess he's suited to teach this mbb class since 80% of this class is elaborated on DNA and RNA

he is an awesome prof. don't miss out on the chance to have him as a prof! yeah he talked pretty fast, but if you actually pay attention to what he says, the stuff is easy. a lot of ppl said the final was hard, it sort of was :P but i really enjoyed his class!

super awesome notes, but talks a bit too fast during lecture. I found going to lecture made info stick much easier than having to learn on ur own. approachable. SUPER FAIR MARKING and really, there are no surprises. I don't know what people are complaining about. minimal effort got me a B. If u did poorly, u prolly missed the big picture...

Terrible exam writer-- midterm was ridiculously easy and general, then the final was the other extreme-- obscure details drawn from perhaps 1% of the course content. Controlling prof with little interest in helping students learn and succeed.
No Comments
very good lecturer but no notes posted - be prepared to write fast or do alot of photocopying; exams are fair but is a difficult marker

Good lectures, but talks WAY too fast. NOT approachable and wants you out of his sight as soon as possible. Tests are fair but the marking is not. Overall the course has a lot of useful information but the information needs to be updated - a lot of the papers are more than 15 years old. One course I regreted taking (the other one being MBB 423).

Clear teaching and notes, fair exams. Great course; you can learn a lot of things you can never imagine. However, this course really depend on the classmates. If everyone provides clear paper summary, it will be an easy course.
really good prof! very helpful, very clear, no surprises on his tests, he really isn't out to get you! learned a LOT from this class, and it was interesting!
A pretty interesting course to take.... I actually learnt something from it. ^_^
No Comments
No Comments

Course not too difficult- 2 non-cum finals and a presentation(paper is assigned by him) in lecture. Think his teaching is pretty clear. But no notes provided 'cept OHTs used in class. (Write fast!) Exam is mostly on student-presentation materials with lots of drawing(both gel images and structures).
